intro: Hieracium gracilipes, commonly known as slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium gracilipes is an herbaceous perennial that spreads through rhizomes and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
